website_summaries.verdict: We love this brawny, but affordable, mid-range router.  Great choice for 4K movie lovers and gamers.
pros: Powerful and smart, this router is a great value, offering strong and well-targeted signal strength
Three high-performance antennas power multiple devices at the same time
cons: Isn't as easy to customize as some models

website_summaries.verdict: This high-speed router is easy to set up and offers an impressive 3,000 sq. ft. of WiFi coverage.
pros: Features include an FTP server, 2 USB ports to share printers and files, and beamforming technology for fast and reliable connections
Comes with the TP-Link Tether app
cons: Some of these suffer from poor 5GHz performance or need to be rebooted frequently

customer_reviews.title: This is a very fine router, works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fine router, works great, very easy to set up. It has a 3 year warranty, and mine lasted a little more than a year when it started getting wonky, not able to remain connected to the internet. I internet chatted with customer service (they seem to be in the US--California--and there is no communication problem) and it took about 1/2 hour for them to determine I needed a replacement. I received a shipping label to return my old router a few days later (it's free) and received my new router a few days later. Sometimes we overlook service and warranty for price and performance. This unit provides both.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bob

customer_reviews.title: Three and one half hours and no internet
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. I'm not some noob. I've been working in tech since the 80s in a variety of industries. I've replaced tons of equipment, built networks from scratch and managed them in both Windows and Mac environments. This is the first time that I've had a problem with equipment that appears to work properly but refuses to fulfill its purpose. It's not helpful that the "support" is all online when I couldn't get online at all. I tried both methods. I did a factory reset and tried again. And again. And again. In the end, I set up my old router and I'm going shopping for another Netgear router right now.
customer_reviews.author: sailor

customer_reviews.title: Horrible router
customer_reviews.text: I bought one like this 18 months ago. The range was fantastic. Then it suddenly stopped working. I ordered a new one and that one would not send out my wifi after an hour of installation procedure via the internet. Moral: A pretty package and high price does not guarantee it is any good. I sent it back and reinstalled my 10 year old Linksys router in less than 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works very well with very good coverage. I wish I could say this about ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a range extender....works very well with very good coverage. I wish I could say this about my provider, Century Link...but at least you get about 1/2 what you are paying for. But if you haqve a good connection to the world, this is a very good wireless router
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost savings over better brands.
customer_reviews.text: From day 1 this unit lost connection to the router up to 3 times per day. The "internet" light would go from blue to orange and I'd have to disconnect the Ethernet cable from the modem for 10 seconds then it wold work again. The range was poor and I had to relocate to the middle of my house to get coverage all over. Video content would frequently downgrade quality doe to poor connection. Recently replaced with a Netgear AC1750 (for the same price) which is more reliable, faster, and has better range.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J.

customer_reviews.title: There are less expensive ones, but you get what you pay for...but this!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced older router which died. This one installed with ease in just minutes. 2400 sq ft two story home. router located lower level at end of house. Great reception anywhere in the house and throughout my yard. Recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: LyremIkcir

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time trying to obtain warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for a year, but then is useless. Requires constant rebooting and the signal is not strong. For this price I expected it to last longer. Tech support is a joke. Company advertises a two year warranty but then does not stand behind it. Two hours of my life wasted on the phone trying to understand customer service's broken English.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I don't write much Amazon reviews, but this product ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't write much Amazon reviews, but this product has truly improved my internet speed. I replaced the modem that came with Verizon FIOS and my internet speed has very noticeably improved and much more consistent. I think the problem was my FIOS modem did not have strong signal to reach my computer at the other side of my apartment and this router definitely have a longer range.
customer_reviews.author: chao

customer_reviews.title: nice when it worked but it doesnt seem to last ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only 6 months and now has "WAN Connection" issues, their customer service is a joke with endless questions if the router is hooked up correctly.... nice when it worked but it doesnt seem to last long.... Looking into a replacement with different brand...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy F

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I’m an IT professional(30 years). I wasted 4 hrs trying to make this thing work for all my devices. 3 devices connected on 2.4 and 5. One connected to WiFi but not internet, another wouldn’t connect to WiFi but the ssids were visible. All of these devices connected with no issue to my Xfinity issued garbage wireless modem. Changed channels, upgraded firmware, rebooted 10 times, turned WiFi security off, etc...pulled up their webpage chat(8th in line) while on hold to their tech support. Decided to return instead of bashing it with a bat in my driveway. In hindsight I should have stopped at 2 hrs but I thought I could find the problem.
customer_reviews.author: BillyMurrayJr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I did plenty of research in my hunt for the perfect replacement for my outdated router. I chose this one and I have been extremely happy with it. My router is in my bedroom and I stream Sling, Netflix, etc on multiple televisions throughout the house. Since I hooked this router up, I have had zero buffering, zero problems, zero frustration with internet connectivity. I am extremely happy with this purchase and would recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: I don't give a lot of five stars on technology items however I've had this router for a couple of years now without any issues. It is just as advanced as the 400.00 units for 1/3 the cost. I am an IT admin (20 years) and this is one of the better (cheap) units out there.
customer_reviews.author: MRR

customer_reviews.title: Decent signal and good performance for a budget unit
customer_reviews.text: As long as you're not saturating this router with too many concurrent devices, it performs very well. We wound up outgrowing it through, and it didn't seem to handle a lot 12-18 devices using smaller amounts of bandwidth at the same time. (Once you add up TVs, smart boxes, phones, computers, consoles, etc., there's a lot more than you think about). If you're just using a few devices this will be a VERY good value priced router. If you're needing to ensure faster wifi connection for a LAN or server arrangement, YMMV with AC1900 speeds for networking.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Top notch device.
customer_reviews.text: Have used TP-Link products for years. Always have had great service from their products. This made decision on what brand to use when upgrading LAN to Gigabit a no-brainer. Installation and setup was a snap. Software switches are plentiful, but default settings probably will cover safety and ease of setup for most users. Wi-fi range was superb. 10 year old TP-Link Mbps wifi WAP was strong but lacked reach in some areas of 3400 s.f. house. New AC1900 is strong and fast not only in house but around property outside. No regrets with this purchase. A-1 product from a great company!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: NOT Connecting to their Cloud router through Smart Phone
customer_reviews.text: I hope I can find another way to connect this device to my other devices. If you connect to their Cloud Router read the fine print. They monitor everything. It is like being spied upon. The company wants to much private information. Not willing to have you intercept my emails and phone calls. Seriously I don’t know who you are but you are out of line. Worse company to deal with. TP Link stopped working after 2 months would not recommend to anyone. And their customer service is horrific
customer_reviews.author: lg212

customer_reviews.title: It started behaving strangely just a few months after I bought it
customer_reviews.text: 5 months after purchasing this product it started behaving unreliably. And now not 9 months later and I can't seem to get it to work at all. All the lights come on and stay on like it's in a bad state. The last time that happened, it eventually started working, but this time after several tries it still doesn't work. I've currently switched back to my old Netgear router. I will reach out to the company soon but are they really going to do something about it? I think it's more likely that my $100 just went down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: This router stopped working after exactly 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This router stopped working after exactly 1 year. I spoke to their tech support, they made me do the firmware upgrade on it. The problem is that the WiFi network keeps disconnecting after few minutes and then reconnects again. It's continuously flapping. I tried everything, reset the router, performed firmware upgrade, changed the channel width and channel settings but nothing works. It is not working so I don't know if I can get a replacement or not? But I started checking other routers from Linksys and Netgear, I think they might prove useful.
customer_reviews.author: SDK

customer_reviews.title: best router I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: best router I've ever had. Easy to setup, fast and reliable. Signal strength is great. Color is ok, but I think black would be better (there seems to be a black one around but is harder to find). Also, there's no way to set it horizontally, either way, it looks ok.
customer_reviews.author: L. Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Antenna's are broke
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this TP-Link router even though a few friends told me not to... But I have 3 of their switches and I like those alot so thought I would give this a shot. Well the router works for the most part all though I still cant get gigabit speeds on it and the wifi does not work less your right next to it because the antenna's were broken when I got it.... Guess I will be buying a different router...
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Graham

customer_reviews.title: Worked until I bought something else. Service is broken see (Note)
customer_reviews.text: This router worked fine for 3 1/2 years. I Upgraded to a mesh system and a different brand. I think the 1900Mbs is over hyped. Never saw that kind of speed. At this point this router is mostly outdated and I would look at something newer. Note: I have put TP-Link on the do not buy list as there warranty replacement is broken. I found out when replacing a switch. A good product that is marred by customer service and endless procedures to get you to just toss the unit.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it died.
customer_reviews.text: This router worked just long enough to get out of Amazon's return period. Then it started hard-locking, not granting IPs, not connecting to internet even when wired, even with a single client, just a paperweight. Called tech support, they walked me through the process of doing a full system reset. Worked again. For a week. Then it crashed again the same way. So I'm not going to be doing this every week (and resetting all my various settings) forever, but tech support seems to think that once they talk me through and get it working it's "fixed." Not sure I'd even want an RMA if offered, probably just get something different entirely. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: C. Converse

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 GHz failed
customer_reviews.text: The 2.4 GHz band no longer accepts connections from almost all of my household appliances and desktop computer. Factory reset and 30-30-30 reset did not resolve the issue. Stopped working 1 year after purchase and has not worked since.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McDermott

customer_reviews.title: This has been my workhorse.  I own 2 of them with DD-WRT.
customer_reviews.text: This has been my workhorse. I own 2 of them with DD-WRT. Dead reliable and VERY fast. Paired with DD-WRT and this router is a beast. If using DD-WRT setup device as follows. 2.4ghz NG-Only Wide HT40 5.0ghz AC-Only Wide VHT80 With these settings you'll maximize throughput of the units WiFi. WPA-PSK with AES 128 bit as WPA2 requires enterprise server account verification.
customer_reviews.author: Jack K

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to setup with a good app interface (for admin management/update). I have had numerous routers. This one works really well for me. The issue I was trying to solve was installation in an older home (lots of lathe/plaster) and multiple floors). This unit sits on the main floor (floor above basement). I have wonderful coverage on the third floor (two floors above where the unit sits). I have had this unit for one year without issue. I have never had to restart due to loss of signal. This unit is great.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Just Installed, Only Time Will Tell - But Incredibly Easy Install!
customer_reviews.text: Caveat; I'm a network engineer. I've got to hand it to TP-Link, that was by FAR the easiest and fastest Access Point I've ever added to a network. Unboxed it, directly connected a computer to it, made the mode Access Point, turned off DHCP, added passphrases to the 2.4 and 5GHz channels, unplugged it from the computer, plugged it (and the computer) back into a switch, and that was it. No more than 5 minutes to set up. Default options are secure (e.g. Guest Network is disabled by default). If this device is robust as the setup is easy, then it'll have been one of the best network equipment purchases I've ever made in 25+ years of geekery.
customer_reviews.author: a-mused

customer_reviews.title: NOTE, Amazon still sending Version 1 with so many issues.
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT have much range. Just ordered C9 but they are still sending Version 1! Version 3 and 4 are available but apparently not to Amazon customers. I believe V1's are outdated units sold here as stated in many reviews. Chatted with someone somewhere from TP Link, with poor writing AND tech skills and got nowhere in 40 minutes. Asked about a firmware upgrade and he insisted it would likely brick the unit. Crazy! Will return, order again and see if I can request V3 or 4. Hardly worth the trouble. Not sure why they continue to send V1 via Amazon. V1 has many issues as has been noted in other reviews. My very old router works better.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth using as a doorstop
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk has been nothing but problems since they day I got it. Even after updating to the latest firmware, it still continues to drop signal & speed randomly. It also has way too many issues working with the latest cable modems. The next stop for this thing is a firing range as target practice. Save your money and go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews for the TP-Link Archer C9 were encouraging. Before buying from Amazon, I wanted to be reassured that I was getting the latest version available. I reached out to customers and chatted with Amazon. The Amazon rep basically said if I didn't receive the latest version ( which is #5 at time of purchase in Oct 2019), that I could return. I received version #5 and am very pleased with the reception, coverage, ease of set-up. Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: challo

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these routers several years ago and they lasted about 3 years. Just a few months ago I had to replace mine because the wifi kept dropping and just wouldn't come back on unless I restarted the unit. When I got the new one, it began to do the same thing but just sporadically. Now it's daily and sometimes multiple times a day. After buying 4 of these, TP LINK won't be getting any more of my money.
customer_reviews.author: S. T.

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in August 2016 and it flat out died in May 2019, so less than a 3 year life. I thinks that’s lousy. While it worked it was OK. I needed to buy a separate antenna to get a decent signal to my desktop which was around 50’ away. Admittedly the line of sight is not 100 pct clear but it is mostly clear with just furniture (not walls) in the way. Whole condo is around 1700 s.f. I never used their tech support, so no comment there. I’m going to try a mesh system now.
customer_reviews.author: longboat key APRN

customer_reviews.title: This router worked great initially, but died in 11 months
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great initially, but died in 11 months. It was on a UPS so not a power issue. Firmware was updated. Company has been VERY slow to process a replacement under warranty. I bought another brand of router to replace it, because I could not wait several WEEKS to get a replacement and have my entire LAN offline! It took a week just to get an RMA number, and another week after that to get the UPS shipping label. Still no replacement unit and no word when it will ship. If you are running a business, as I am, I absolutely would NOT recommend this due to the warranty replacement extreme time delays.
customer_reviews.author: PMcD

customer_reviews.title: Performed very poorly compared to a similar priced Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Range is not very good. The refurbished netgear nighthawk is the same price as this. The "range" on my macbook pro looked the same with both routers, but the speed was drastically different. In the same room, my speed with this guy was 25 mbps w/20 ms ping, and with the netgear nighthawk the speed was 61 mbps with 12 ms ping. Granted, this is on a 100 mbps line, but I would rather have 61 mbps than 25 mbps. Also, when a firmware update is applied, all settings go back to factory, which is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is utterly useless
customer_reviews.text: We had had this router for a little more than a year and it started giving inconsistent speeds, if you could find the signal at all. I had Comcast come out and they did extended testing of our lines and their service, and everything checked out. I contacted TP-Link for warranty purposes. They asked a mulititude of questions multiple times. After jumping through those hoops, I got an email stating my case had been sent to senior staff, and then I got another email requesting I allow remote access to my computer so they could help me reconfigure my network environment. Umm... no. I'm done. No more TP Link anything for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Happy with speed and wireless coverage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Medialink MWN-WAPR300N router,]. Product is easy to setup, and has provided a significant performance increase over the old router. Previously we were unable to obtain the full 100Mbps of our internet service when going through the Medialink device (experiencing ~80Mbps), now we are able to see speeds >100Mbs making us comfortable that we are now benefiting from the full speed we pay our ISP for. Wireless range also seems improved, using the device in a ~2,700sqft single story plan, router is in a corner room, but coverage is not an issue throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I can't in good conscience recommend this router
customer_reviews.text: I can't in good conscience recommend this router. As a 15+ year veteran and former senior engineer at Broadcom, the company that designs and produces the SOC used in this router, I am appalled at the shoddy implementation and lack of support provided by TP-Link. The router is plagued with web management interface problems that render it unusable by many. Just google 'archer c9 unsupported browser' and see for yourself. Furthermore this is a long standing issue, with many support tickets opened, only to be closed by TP-Link without offering a viable solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanmcyr

customer_reviews.title: Older version 3.0 received, bugged
customer_reviews.text: Update after 2 week use. This older version 3.0 received (seller’s choice/error) does not have all the functions listed (cloud access and night time LED off, etc). Returning it and replacing newer with version 5.0 for full range of features listed in description. This is the third brand name router I purchased over the last few years. This one performs the best thus far. WiFi device connections have been reliable, fast and router has significantly more extensive coverage. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken J C

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Router often drops the signal. I have to reboot my echo and echo dot often, sometimes multiple times per day. I stream TV service and the router often fails here as well. I did not have this problem with my linksys 1900ac, which was replaced due to a lightning strike. I will replace this router with a better quality one. When it functions the signal has decent distance and strength.
customer_reviews.author: Trailspike

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC1900 was a good investment to cover the whole house.
customer_reviews.text: A definite upgrade over just the built-in WiFi of my Xfinity router. There were several dead spots in my house that even a WiFi extender couldn't help with. This router, adds 5G speed for computers and covers the house completely. Easy to set up. Easy to link to Netgear WiFi extender. Also, since it is summer, a lot of outdoor WiFi use was in order. The Xfinity router just simply didn't have enough power to reach most of the deck and the rest of the back yard. The TP-Link AC1900 covers the entire deck and yard in back. Very happy with the results. Plus the Xfinity router with WiFi just didn't have the best security capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fujimoto

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this, it sucks
customer_reviews.text: Super-easy install, to yield super-crappy, often dropped, WiFi networks that you can see just dropping on and off availability on your devices. I have to sit and wait or turn my WiFi connection on and off to get this POS to come back. Don't buy this even if they push it for 50% off...unless you're fine with "50% available" WiFi. So PO'd I made the wrong choice with this crap.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent loss of wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: I had this router for nearly two years now. It generally works fine, but once in a while you run into wifi signal problem. Once this problem starts, it is very, very annoying as you don't have reliable wifi. The problem may go away on its own, but who knows? I searched the internet, downloaded the latest firmware, disable ipv6 support, and if it would work, ready to sacrifice a chicken (my neighbor's). But no dice. No reliable answers on the internet either.
customer_reviews.author: Rational

customer_reviews.title: It made my Wi-Fi, really fast Wi-Fi!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am pleased with this router. I purchased it and the tp-link USB wireless adapters to make sure everything was matched up. So far, I'm pretty happy with it. However, just like every other router I have had, I've had to reboot this a couple of times since I've owned it. I have not tried to plug a printer into it however I did try plugging in a hard drive Intuit to use as a network drive but it really wasn't set up the way I wanted it to and it was not very configurable. However, as far as my network, the speeds are great. And it has been very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Christian in Florida

customer_reviews.title: hacked
customer_reviews.text: I can't beleive my eyes when I first noticed that it was hacked. I did set it up as wpa2 password still its a shame that I spent $120 for this junk. I contacted customer support they told me to update the very last available update, and guess what it got bricked after update. As it is not out of warranty they can't help me any more. I will never buy these routers again.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap,I purchased this unit on 12/1/16, after two years of connectivity issues and one unit replacement it quit working again, I have no desire to deal with TP-link's terrible excuse for customer support, so I realized I always go back to my old obsolete Netgear router to get me through while I work on the TP-Link, so I just ordered a new Netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: Allen B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 4 years - then just died.
customer_reviews.text: It could be argued that four years is a reasonable lifespan. But the Linksys router this replaced had worked longer, and is back in service while we await a new router. The router's lights just went out in the middle of the day. No power issues, or storms. I rebooted it - the lights would light for a few seconds, and then go out again. Kaput. While four years may be considered reasonable by some; my next router, and likely none of my future routers will be made by TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: DRS-1

customer_reviews.title: Using as an Access Point - very nice once configured
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Wifi router. Added as second unit for basement hardwired to main unit. Configuring for Access Point is not straight forward. I upgraded the Firmware (recommended), which wiped out my previous settings. So I had to reconfigure again. I set the Password to same as our other, main WIFI. Thing to note is that the 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz bands each have their own password. The wifi would not work for me until I discovered this. I was using the 5G and had set the password on the default one the Admin UI shows, 2.4G. Set them both and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Polutta

customer_reviews.title: Fully Featured with Great Interface
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic router with solid signal. The guest network options are great and allow me to keep guest devices from accessing my personal network and even from accessing each other. This allows me to keep 3rd party devices like WiFi outlets from snooping on my personal traffic or talking to each other while still doing their jobs. Currently there's no support for DD-WRT but there is a GoFundMe (look for "dwrt-upgrade-for-tplink-archer-c9-v5") to get the firmware for it built up. Check it out!
customer_reviews.author: Kashif J. Chowdhry

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drops 5GHz wifi: updated
customer_reviews.text: I can sit my phone 5 feet from the router and the signal will drop in and out. And I verified it's not my phone b/c I have a second router (Asus RT-AC68U) used as a bidge and my phone never drops if connected there. Installing DD-WRT does not solve the issue. It appears to be a 5GHz radio problem. UPDATE: If you change some nvram settings on the router, it appears to work better. For instructions on how to flash your nvram, search "telnet DD-WRT" or "ssh DD-WRT" Here are the settings: nvram set wl_distance=300 nvram set wl0_distance=300 nvram commit reboot
customer_reviews.author: Andy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No issues-even after someone plugged in the wrong wall plug...
customer_reviews.text: So after cycling forever with no internets, a repair person was sent out (hat tip to Charter) to figure out what we had done wrong. Turns out it was plugged into the wrong wall plug. Which caused issues, it turns out, like not enough power. That said, the repair person figured it out immediately, rewired it, and even helped us set it up. It flies, reaches all corners of the house and most of the yard, and is only our second router in 14 years. It's so much faster than the last one (which was also a TP-Link). We only changed it because the plastic had begun to yellow...it was old. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Madtruk

customer_reviews.title: Hope the Power Never Goes Out
customer_reviews.text: I bought the router and waited to install it since I was in school, and did not want to chance messing up my internet connection. I finally installed it, and about a month later the power went out due to a storm. It was plugged into a surge protector, but the internet port stopped working after that. I was told that since it was due to a power outage, that they could not replace the router. I spent way to much money for a router that only worked 1 month. Luckily I still had my old Linksys router that has made it through many power outages. I will never spend that much on a useless product again.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 11 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my previous router went out Sept. 2018.now 11 months later this router is no longer working. I called my internet company and they said my modem was receiving info and sending to router but router was not sending info out. I rebooted everything SEVERAL times and nothing. I finally spoke with my internet server and for $5.00 they could turn my router on that came with the modem. I choose to do this. This modem cost me $99.00 and 11 months of use, way cheaper the way I'm doing it now. Do not buy not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Irishnana

customer_reviews.title: My TP Link C9 units never lasted past warranty period
customer_reviews.text: My first TP-Link C9 lasted 22 months. The latest one has lasted 18 months. All purchased on Amazon. The wireless goes out and in my home that means chaos. Imagine being on a wireless security system, or wireless game unit, or wireless TV accessory (like a Roku)? Nothing works when wireless is down. The regular warranty is 24 months. I will have to buy a different solution today because My family will not wait for me to send my unit in to be fixed under warranty. Now, when the Tp link is up and running it works great and is fast. I would only hope the units would at least reach there out of warranty periods.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosM

customer_reviews.title: Way better coverage and speed
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Comcast in my area. Called Comcast tech support and gave them the MAC address. A few minutes later I have the best speeds I have had. Twice as fast as the Comcast modem. I paired with the tp link ac1900 router and I get better coverage and double the connection speed I had with the Comcast gateway. Should pay for both in just over a year but, I switched for better coverage , reliability and speed. I got them all.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsnake

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new router since the one I had wasn't putting out enough signal to reach my sunroom or back deck. My wife uses her smartphone on the deck and not knowing lost the signal and reverted to Verizon data. Of course she exceeded the monthly data allowance and we got hit with a large overage charge. I ordered this router based on the reviews and they were spot on. My laptop and phone signal outside are both at the max. This thing must have a range of at least 1000 feet. Shipping was fast, setup was easy and the interface was a snap. No messing with wifi extenders, etc. Get this and be done with it. Great router.
customer_reviews.author: W. Long

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I won't get into a lengthy review about the technical stuff. The install was straight forward and aside from having to manually reset (because of the service provider's signal pikes), it has worked without any problems for the last two years. I have recommended it to my friends and family. Note: I bought the same brand modem as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: Good speeds, bad DHCP
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, works as expected and provides high speeds. The DHCP module gave way after a few months of usage of mine. The customer care is attentive though and listens to your problems. They offered me an RMA but I decided to keep this one to avoid the same situation later and I am happy with static IP assignment for all my devices. The NAT forwarding also works great. Haven't used any other features so cannot comment. Just took off one star for the screwed up DHCP.
customer_reviews.author: sneak_pigeon

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: If I could have given negative stars I would have. I purchased this product in August and only four months later it has stopped working. I am an I.T. Engineer, I know how to troubleshoot but the TP-Link Tech Support forced me to troubleshoot it for two hours with a representative whom I could not even understand. Then she finally deemed it was faulty! Now that they have deemed it faulty I have to pay to return the faulty device to them. Then once they receive the device that I paid to return they will consider approving a warranty exchange. Worst product and Customer Service I could have ever imagined. Please do not buy this product save yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because I needed something that was lower profile and could stand upright to place it in the new inset that we'd built for our TV. Our old router had a broken antenna from our kids and could not stand upright - so it didn't fit well behind the TV. This was super easy to install and go through the setup via their app. The only hard part about any of it was getting my ISP to add the new modem that I'd also bought. Once that was activated, this router worked flawlessly and connected right away to my laptop, phone and other wireless devices (as I'd used the same name and password as the previous router)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 1 yr and CRAPPY SUPPORT - DO NOT BUY THIS POS
customer_reviews.text: This router is barely been used for 1 year. All of a sudden one morning my Archer C9 v5 router just stopped working and keeps flashing and power cycling on its own. Tried factory reset but no luck. This router is barely one year old. This was my 2nd TP link router in less than 3 years. Customer service is THE WORST. I will NEVER BUY TP Link products. they are POS and their service is even worst. Support is based in China or Philippines and they are extremely incompetent and on top of that rude.
customer_reviews.author: A L

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for 10 year old obsolete TP-Link. (It worked great all that time.) Similar specs to pricier routers. Easy setup. Good range in both frequencies. My two cents: Some folks may think they need even higher bandwidth capability or otherwise are seduced by high-priced units, but a unit like this one or other 1900's will stream several devices simultaneously at top speeds if you have a fast ISP. (I have Charter with 60mbs.) Simultaneous TV, two cellphones, and laptop stream effortlessly. If you have a slow ISP, a faster router won't help a bit. Don't spend north of 200 unless you are a business.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review - got wrong advice from installer
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a negative review of this product - (do;t see it here) but it was a mistake. The installers of my 1GB service said one of the recievers was bad - i found out this was not necessariy true - the download speed is depandant upond many factiors - wireless, level of equipment, which server you use etc... However the unit i got was a hardare version 1 (TP is up to version 5) and very old software - software is updatable. If I had bought from someone like best buy the hardware version would have been later. I am afraid Amazon may be a dumping ground for out of date (but still very usable ) tech stuff
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup improved range and throughput
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 6 year old Netgear N600 Dual Band router that was losing power several times a day. The setup process was very easy using the browser based interface. More importantly, both range and throughput improvements are dramatic. We are no longer dropping the wireless connection in the living room due to range issues. Furthermore, we have 100 mbit cable service and we are achieving those speeds over the wireless channels both sitting next to the router and in the living room where we used to have much reduced speeds. I am extremely pleased with this router.
customer_reviews.author: T. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Range and Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this wireless router when my old one bit the dust. The range and power on this are excellent. I had wireless outside cameras mounted at my house, and never had any problem connecting or staying connected. And I'm talking about and old home with real plaster walls, not wallboard. Plus I think it is a very good looking piece of computer equipment and can be mounted on your wall. I'd buy with confidence if your undecided what to buy in a wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: Airbus30B

customer_reviews.title: Yes it is wall mountable.
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write reviews so soon after a purchase but something about all of the reviews I am seeing is bugging me. This this is absolutely, completely, unequivocally and totally wall mountable. I keep reading reviews, even on tech sites, that list "Not wall mountable" as a con. They specifically ship it with small risers that are used to make wall mounting simple even though the little stand isn't removable. YES. it is wall mountable. Ok, with that out of the way, it seems pretty solid so far. from box to complete set up took about 5 minutes. I will revise my review down the road if things change but, so far, it really is a five star product.
customer_reviews.author: Schwing

customer_reviews.title: Started off great, but needs to be reset every two weeks
customer_reviews.text: The TP-Link AC1900 replaced a router I had for over 10 years. The difference was amazing. More range and better speeds. However, it kept losing signals. I had to reset every two weeks. After the third time, I returned it. Bought a Nighthawk and no problems so far. Its a shame cause I liked the unique design
customer_reviews.author: R. Varghese

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 days of use. 1 star.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the stock router built into the CenturyLink modem/router combo. The packaging was excellent. Installation required a call to CenturyLink to get the router to talk to the modem. But after only 3 days of use, the unit failed. Turned it off, unplugged the power supply and then reconnected. The lights came on momentarily before shutting down again. Spoke with Ella from Amazon customer support. Nothing she suggested worked. Will return and find a reliable router to replace it with.
customer_reviews.author: Terry's

customer_reviews.title: Reliable for 3+ years
customer_reviews.text: Have this unit more than 3 years and still work strong. I have 23 clients connected. There is no dynamic DDNS from tp-link server which is not convenient, also no airtime fairness option. The coverage is ok, not great, I have 2400 sq house, all 3 floors have 2.4 and 5 ghz signals, but very week on the deck. I saw the price goes up way too much from $70 new when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: PeterC

customer_reviews.title: Controls Net use = drops connection daily
customer_reviews.text: Horrible 18 month experience with this router. Constantly drops the WiFi connection each and every day, multiple times per day. First unit I received was supposed to be new, but had been opened and was missing paperwork and one antenna. Amazon sent replacement as soon as they received first unit return. Set-up was easy, but dislike that there’s no option to create my own password since assigned password is difficult to remember( although burned into my brain now that I’ve had to reset every day). Range doesn’t cover a 1600 sq ft house.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My wifi does not reach from one end of my house to the other, so I bought this router based on the recommendation in an article addressing this problem. I read other people's reviews on Amazon that touted how they could get wifi all over their house with this product. It was easy to install but did not help with extending the range of my wifi signal, and I have a small 3 bedroom house.
customer_reviews.author: Chrys

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. Easy to setup and manage. Provides coverage over my whole house (2900sqft single level). I can get 2.5ghz to the edges of the 9500sgft lot. We have a lot of devices and I have not seen a drop in streaming or connection yet. We sometimes operate two TVs streaming, a couple active phones and a laptop playing games and some how we are still good. Impressive. Helps that I have good bandwidth from spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Horrible warranty process
customer_reviews.text: This router itself is very easy to set up and works great. The negative review is how they handle the warranty when an issue happens. After having the router for maybe a month the system quit working, after dealing with support agreeing the device is defective I shipped it back at your own expense. They received the product per tracking number and still took over a week and several emails to even acknowledge they received it. Then continued to take over another week and several emails prior to them sending a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Marlaina

customer_reviews.title: Hangs repeatedly, just long enough that the replacement is now out of return window. Boo!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one and it began hanging within a week. Only option was to pull power and reboot the router. Nothing else was touched and the Internet would come back. Updated the firmware and still would hang about once every week. Amazon supplied a replacement. I immediately updated the firmware and it seems stable but it is now requiring a reboot maybe every 2 weeks. I figured maybe send it back to Amazon and purchase a different router, maybe one of the nicer Netgears, but I am now 2 weeks outside the return window, so I guess no customer satisfaction on this one. Too expensive of a router top have these problems and to now have to eat it. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item today and started to set it up. The antennas are supposed to screw onto the top of the device. One of the antennas is defective and doesn't screw on. I am returning it and ordering the same item. Now to see if replacement item has the same problem, or another problem. I'll update this when I know moree.
customer_reviews.author: Crager

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you're not going to beat this one. I've had two TP-Link wireless routers in the past and they both impressed me with their high quality and ease of use. This one far outstrips my older one in capability and speed. I get a strong signal through my apartment and it's fast. The app is also nice for management, works smoothly and also simple to use. Works flawlessly with my smart TV, PS4, pc, phone, and every other thing I connect to it. Easy to set up and modify for your purposes. Looks nice too!
customer_reviews.author: CRGamble

customer_reviews.title: The range was no better than my netgear modem router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to increase my wifi range. I tried it as the primary router after disabling the NAT on my modem router. The range was no better than my netgear modem router. The single is poor on the second storey. I now use it in AP mode with a MOCA Ethernet connection through coax wiring. Every few days it loses its internet connection requiring reset. So it is not reliable in AP mode and the standard use wifi signal is not much better in spite of the 3 impressive antennae. I am disappointed by the claims of a long range.
customer_reviews.author: Watchman

customer_reviews.title: will not link to printer
customer_reviews.text: Spent way too much time to get hooked up. Linked to computers ok and tv but not the Canon mx920 printer. Printer found router but would not work. Old router worked fine and still using it. Waited too long to return. Now great paper weight. Went through all the troubleshooting on line with manufacturer to no avail. Also it kept unlinking from devices.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Wilco

customer_reviews.title: Dead four weeks after warranty ended.
customer_reviews.text: Four weeks almost to the day after warranty ends, it dies. It was always glitchy, especially toward the end and needed a reboot way too often. It was a version #1, don't know if that make a difference. It worked great when it worked, but I hated needing to reboot it all the time. And it dies at 25 months ??
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Works great on 802.11ac, easy to configure.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Beamforming supports strong 802.11ac signal on all my devices anywhere in the house. Getting transmit rates of 527 kbps. Easy to configure and noticed an unexpected bonus during configuration. You can configure the lights on the front panel to turn off during certain hours to the blue lights won't disturb you at night. Only thing that causes me to rate it 4 starts instead of 5 is that you must manually configure it as an Access Point. It can be configured by giving it a static IP address, turning off DHCP, and plugging the cable to the router into a LAN port instead of a the WAN port.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Really fast! When it works.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you like tinkering with software and being on the phone with customer support, do not buy! It worked great for a few months. Then it kept dropping my internet. I updated firmware did all sorts or tinkering with IP address and MAC cloning. I can't tell you how many times I have rebooted this thing. I would have spent 5 times as much at this point for better software considering the time I spent. I am done at this point. If they don't accept a return or give me a better model it will just go in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: James Cook

customer_reviews.title: TP Link AC1900
customer_reviews.text: This wireless router has worked great for us. We have coverage over at least half of the house now. Sometimes it takes a while to get coverage in the far bedrooms upstairs. The speed improvement has been amazing over our older router. I have not had any issues with having to constantly reboot the router. I can only remember having to reboot it once or twice. We are using the 2_5 setting, as this speed is faster then 5 one. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bukowski

customer_reviews.title: Super fast, great deal :)
customer_reviews.text: Was time to upgrade to a wireless AC router as I got a Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 (2014) which supports AC, got this for 99$ superfast, had to jury rig a ceiling mount but it works (zip tied to a 30 lb capacity toggle-bolt plant hanger, with a carabiner screwed to the ceiling just to keep it level xD Super fast easy to set up, a but bigger and heavier than I expected but not a real issue since I ceiling mounted it :) Oh I would recommend turning off WMM in your wireless settings if you have a 100+ megabit connection, it just slowed me down...
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Culver

customer_reviews.title: Very surprised at how shipped
customer_reviews.text: Product seems ok, have not had time yet to configure. Reviewing mainly because I'm very surprised at how product was shipped. Label applied directly to manufacturer's box (no outer box to protect or conceal contents) and no tape to seal (or indicate tampering in transit). All I had to do to access contents was lift a cardboard flap. Everything appears to be there but IMO this is an unsafe and shoddy shipping practice in modern times, especially when the box has a great-big picture of a high-tech router on it. For this reason alone I will probably avoid this seller in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had promise.
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased Oct 2018. It has been an ok router. Over time I had experienced issues where it would restart on it's own or completely drop 5g bandwidth. Range can barely cover 1200 square feet and that's inconsistent. In the beginning was a good router but may have been ruined either by time or firmware. Today it just can't maintain a connection, wired or wireless.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade my current TP-Link and was hoping this would help out with the issues of lag we were having. This allowed me to utilize 20 Mb more on my internet connection but still caused lag when multiple devices were connected trying browse at the same time. May be a good router for a few devices but not the 20+ that I have currently.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Nunnally

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and powerful.  Super easy setup too!
customer_reviews.text: Solved all of my problems and eliminated need for repeaters and booster! I had an older, but highly rated router and doubted this would make a difference but I was wrong. This thing is outstanding and reliable thus far. I used to need repeaters and booster, all of which are a royal pain. Also my t-stat would constantly send me messages telling me it had lost it's signal. That hasn't happened once with this. And to think I was thinking it was crappy internet service....
customer_reviews.author: A Real Person

customer_reviews.title: Can't do WIRED GB
customer_reviews.text: This is ONLY a review for GB WIRED connection. Notice I said WIRED, NOT wifi. I know how to do comparison tests, so keep your "gadget guy expertise" comments to yourself, there was NOTHING wrong with my comparison tests. Works great if your internet service for example is 100 MB, but after upgrading to CenturyLink GB service, the WIRED connection (directly connected to the TP router) doesn't crack 300 MB. Did same test using the crap CL router that comes with the upgrade and getting 980 MB doing same test. I was impressed with the Archer C9 when I had my 100 MB service, has great coverage, but for GB internet, this router sucks, waste of $.
customer_reviews.author: jda

customer_reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW - Just purchased one for me!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter and she reports its working perfectly! Update 01/04/2019 Just got one of these for myself. Outstanding setup even with several custom settings I made to dovetail into current network. Web based setup could not have been easier especially after downloading and reviewing the very nice User's Guide. I pre-configured it by connecting directly to Mac and made all my custom changes. This limited down time only time to plug things in and reboot everything.
customer_reviews.author: JPSilver

customer_reviews.title: Great router but please ship it in a brown box
customer_reviews.text: I love the router but please put it in a box when you ship it. It’s just begging to get stolen when you advertise exactly what it is on the shipping box. The router itself is amazing though. I use it as a wireless bridge and it’s the fastest router I have used. The only thing that is annoying is that the 20 dollar tp link has a built in tool to set it up as a wireless bridge or an access point but this one that costs 5 times as much does not. Kind of annoying but there are guides online. Great router though.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Too early to tell
customer_reviews.text: Speed is no different than AC1200, but it's limited by the ATT gateway anyway. Seems to be more consistent with tp-link N type adapter instead of tp-link AC type. Not sure about other makes of wireless adapters. Maybe a firmware issue. Adapter type doesn't effect speed anyway with one wall and 35 foot distance (same floor).
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2.5 years and out of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: The router worked fine, but broke after 2.5 years of ownership. The warranty is for 2 year so I emailed them asking if I can still file a claim and they didnt even reply. I shouldn't need to buy a new $100+ router every 2 years. I replaced it with a Linksys which I had prior to this one and worked for 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gina A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I fiddled around with Netgear routers for sometime and got frustrated and went looking for another product. This TP link router was super easy to setup and the signal strength has been solid across my house. I have about a 1,600 sq ft house and the router is located upstairs in a media closet. It reaches outside and even in the garage. The dual band with 5.8ghz and the 2.4ghz helps a lot with the amount of devices I have. Zero dropouts and no issues with this router. Solid speeds. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent 3+ hours try to configure this to work and it hasn’t succeeded yet following the directions. I am Sorry I bought this product. I hired someone to install for me and it is constantly going to "sleep". Waking it up is not quick; sometimes/often I have to re-start it. It works no better than the years-old product I bought it to replace. It's going back if they'll take it and, if they won't, it'll go to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Y.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: This router work great in the beginning but only lasted me 10 months and it just completely stopped working
customer_reviews.author: ramesquita

customer_reviews.title: Lag free gaming on ps4. Tp link is fantastic for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I got this router specifically for gaming on ps4. My old router had lag issues and gaming was hard and not smooth even when hard wired to LAN. This new router is excellent. Gaming is super smooth and I can actually play without any lag which made online gaming 100% better. I highly recommend this router, it has a lot of features for optimized data flow. Tp link is fantastic for gaming
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My speed increased, along with my happiness.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older Netgear router. This was plug n play in my custom Windows 10 pc. Didn't have to do a firmware update, or install any cumbersome software. I immediately noticed a wired speed increase of about 25mbps. I also noticed a wireless increase of about 20mbps. Having the 3 external antennas is a big help, but it also has directional wireless. Which means it will broadcast to your nearest device in the direction your device is, giving you more reliable signals. I've also noticed a ping decrease when playing multiplayer games online. So overall, this router had helped me in every aspect of my internet experience. The price is amazing for what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Best

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. It allows for great speeds with multiple devices no problem! It also doesn't have heating issues and boots up fast in case it is accidentally unplugged. If you're getting this router for 3DS streaming you'll get sporadic fps unless you cap it at 30. It'll range from 45-50fps without capping it. I've also had less sever disconnects and lag since switching. My downloads tend to max out at 30MB/s, but it isn't being bottle necked.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: When it is functioning it does a good job and has good range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in April of 2016. This router has been a mixed bag. When it is functioning it does a good job and has good range. From day one the problem has been the router needs to be rebooted once every day or two. It will completely stop responding and all clients will disconnect, both on the 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz bands. A simple power cycle and everything is up and running again. Touching my hand to the back of the router and it is noticeably hot, and it seems to run hot all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: foo

customer_reviews.title: Good router for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was the highest rated wifi router on some surveys I read so I ordered it. It has lived up to that reputation since I hooked it up to a wireless internet antenna two months ago, the wireless N covers the house well enough and I have not had any reason to even look at it. Best recommendation I can offer. It is made to sit on a desk or shelf or whatever and they do provide some brackets to let it hang on two screws on the wall but they are kind of clumsy and hold the router away from the wall, but not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkertom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a router to replace my old Apple Airport Extreme. After a ton of research, I settled on this one and I'm glad I did. The range on this router well exceeds what I had been getting previously, and while my computer only has 802.11n, it's able to pull 90Mb/s from 150-160 feet away with walls in between me and the router. Since installation, I've not had a single minute of downtime that I can attribute to the router.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Overheats easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router about a year ago and for a year it worked great. The problem is it is intended to sit upright, and it falls over very easily (the first design flaw). Once tipped over, the front can get very hot, and just recently it seems to have heated up enough that it no longer works. The lights come on, but it acts as if there is no internet. The overheating plus the ease of tipping make it very likely to overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Chelaru

customer_reviews.title: Known defect...  do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 9 months, then started intermittently dropping internet connection. Under warranty, so the manufacturer replaced the unit. Now the new unit is doing the same thing... dropping internet connection. The issue is well documented online. This is my first, and last, TP-Link product. Netgear, here I come....
customer_reviews.author: Panzer

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC1900 Smart Wireless Router - Beamforming Dual Band Gigabit WiFi Internet Routers for Home, High Speed, Long Range, Ideal for Gaming (Archer C9)
product_meta.description:
ESSENTIAL HOME WIFI ROUTER - AC1900 WHOLE HOME COVERAGE WIRELESS WIFI ROUTER

 * Eliminate connection issues in your home or office and get greater coverage and reliable wifi
 * Share local media, files and printers over the included USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 ports
 * Take advantage of the FTP server to access files stored on the Archer C9 while you are away
 * Reduce ping while gaming with the 1GHz dual-core processor


WHAT THIS PRODUCT DOES:
This AC1900 wifi router is best for a connected home. Whether you have smart home products, 4k streaming, online video gaming, or the whole family’s smartphones, the Archer C9 is engineered for fast and reliable wifi for the entire home. The 1GHz dual-core processor will ensure that your media streaming will not buffer if someone else is downloading a 4K movie in another room. Perhaps you have simultaneous devices connected taking up bandwidth, the beamforming technology will laser-focus your wireless signal to where you need it most. Superior wifi bandwidth utilization increases wifi range, delivering highly targeted and efficient wireless connections. Never more will you need to miss that climatic action scene, or booted out of a gaming server. TP-Link’s AC1900 wireless router is the solution for your home network. 

Frequency Range: 2.4GHz and 5GHz; Interface Available: 4 x 10/100/1000Mbps LAN Ports , 1 10/100/1000Mbps WAN Port, 1 USB 3.0 Port + 1 USB 2.0 Port; Protocols Supported: Supports IPv4 and IPv6; System Requirement: Microsoft Windows 98SE NT 2000 XP Vista, or Windows 7 Windows 8/8.1/10, MAC OS NetWare UNIX or Linux; Wireless Standards: IEEE 802.11ac/n/a 5GHz, IEEE 802.11b/g/n 2.4GHz
feature_bullets: 1 of wireless routers for Home which is compatible with all Wi Fi devices, 802.11ac and older
Gigabit router with 4 gigabit LAN ports, fast Access to Multiple connected wired devices, also ideal as gaming router
Long range Coverage by 3 external antennas; FCC less than 30dBm
Beamforming Technology makes the router Smart detecting where you need fast wi fi
Easily Share media with 1x USB 3.0 and 1x 2.0 ports to easily Share Printers, files, and media across Your network
Includes Industry leading 2 year Warranty and Free 24/7 technical Support
1G hertz Powerful dual core processor easily handles Multiple devices (Laptops, Tablets, phones, Smart Home, Alexa Enabled devices and more); Operating Temperature: 0℃ to 40 ℃ (32 ℉ to 104℉)

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10, 8.1, 8 and below, MAC OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars5,941 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
